Package cams.view.base

Class Form

java.lang.Object
cams.view.base.Form
All Implemented Interfaces:
Displayable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ChangePasswordForm, CreateCampForm, EditDescriptionForm, EditEnquiryForm, EditLocationForm, EditNameForm, EditSuggestionForm, FilterStrategyForm, LoginForm, ReplyEnquiryForm, StaffSuggestionMenu, SubmitEnquiryForm, SubmitSuggestionForm
public class Form extends Object implements Displayable
Base class for all user interface elements which requires user input and runs an action after retrieving them. This base class enables displaying a prompt alongside several input fields which obtains user input. Specific forms in this application like LoginForm are implemented as extensions from this base class.

To use this base form, extend from or construct this base class, set the prompt and add the appropriate input fields, each with their own label. The order of input fields added corresponds to the order in which they are displayed in the standard output.

Usage example by extension: 

 
 public class SpecificForm extends Form {
     public SpecificForm(Scanner scanner) {
         super(scanner);
         setTitle("Form title goes here.");

         // Will appear as the first input field
         addInput(new TextBox("Label 1", scanner));

         // Will appear as the second input field
         addInput(new TextBox("Label 2", scanner));

         setAction(new ItemAction() {
             public void execute() {
                 System.out.println("Getting user inputs completed.");
             }
         });
     }
 }

Usage example by association: 

 
 public class Foo {
     public void bar() {
         Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
         Form form = new Form(sc);
         form.setTitle("Form title goes here.");

         // Will appear as the first input field
         form.addInput(new TextBox("Label 1", scanner));

         // Will appear as the second input field
         form.addInput(new TextBox("Label 2", scanner));

         form.setAction(new ItemAction() {
             public void execute() {
                 System.out.println("Getting user inputs completed.");
             }
         });
     }
 }

The result of the example above: 

 Form title goes here.
 Label 1:
 Label 2:

  • Method Details

    • getTitle

      public String getTitle()
      Retrieves this form's title.
      Returns:
      form title

    • setTitle

      public void setTitle(String title)
      Assigns this form's title.
      Parameters:
      title - title to be displayed

    • setAction

      public void setAction(ItemAction action)
      Assigns the action to be run after this form completes retrieving user inputs. This form action should not be empty.
      Parameters:
      action - form action

    • addInput

      public void addInput(TextBox input)
      Adds a new user input field to the form. Input fields added to the form cannot be removed afterward.
      Parameters:
      input - labelled form input field

    • getValues

      public Map<String,String> getValues()
      Retrieves the current values of all input fields inside this form as a map, where the key is the input field/text box ID and the value is its corresponding value.
      Returns:
      map of input field labels to values

    • display

      public void display()
      Clears the standard output and displays the form title and the first user input field initially. Waits and captures user input and displays the next user input field afterward. Repeats this until there are no more input fields left to display.
      Specified by:
      display in interface Displayable
